listitem.para: Java Developer Kit (JDK) 1.5.x or greater for compiling/building
The JAVA_HOME environment variable must be set to the directory where the JDK is installed, e.g., c:\Program Files\jdk.1.5.0_22.
Maven 1.0.2 or greater (required when installing source)
Ant 1.7.1 or greater (required when building reference document or javadoc)

section.title: Source Installation
section.para:
This procedure explains how to install from the source distribution.
Extract source from the ZIP file into a directory of your choice.
For a source distribution, the file name will be similar to: hedwig-x.x-src.zip.
Build Hedwig using Maven and Java 1.5.
The method of building Hedwig is the following:
mvn clean package
If the above build fails on some tests, type the following:
mvn clean package -Dmaven.test.skip=true
If you prefer to use an IDE, then you can auto-generate the IDE's project file using maven plugins:
mvn eclipse:eclipse
Proceed to the with binary distribution file in assembly/target directory.

listitem.para: Extract the binary distribution file into a directory of your own.
For a windows binary distribution, the filename will be similar to: hedwig-x.x.zip.
For a unix binary distribution, the filename will be similar to: hedwig-x.x.tar.gz.
Proceed to the chapter of this document.

section.title: Building Manual
section.para:
You can build this manual from source distribution.
cd xdoc ant
Ant will build this book with the above command. The supplied build.xml will build html, html_single and PDF version of this book.

section.title: Building Javadoc
section.para:
You can optionally build your own copy of the Javadoc. The following command will build the Javadoc API reference documentation.
mvn javadoc:aggregate
The Javadoc API reference documents will be built at target/site/apidocs sub-directory. Double-click the index.html file to view the Javadocs.
